column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Supervisor Patient Care Service to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      The Supervisor of Patient Care Services plays a crucial role in overseeing and coordinating the delivery of patient care within a healthcare facility      This position involves managing a team of healthcare professionals, ensuring adherence to quality standards, and contributing to the overall efficiency and effectiveness of patient care services      The Supervisor collaborates with various departments to maintain a high level of patient satisfaction and safety        Responsibilities:        Team Leadership:Supervise and lead a team of healthcare professionals, including nurses, medical assistants, and support staff      Provide guidance, support, and regular feedback to ensure optimal performance and professional development      Patient Care Coordination:Coordinate and monitor patient care activities to ensure seamless and efficient service delivery      Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other healthcare providers to optimize patient outcomes      Quality Assurance:Implement and uphold quality standards for patient care services      Conduct regular audits and assessments to identify areas for improvement and ensure compliance with healthcare regulations      Patient Safety:Oversee and promote patient safety initiatives      Implement and enforce safety protocols and best practices within the department      Staff Training and Development:Develop and deliver training programs for staff to enhance their skills and knowledge      Facilitate ongoing education to ensure staff members are up-to-date with the latest healthcare practices      Collaboration with Other Departments:Work collaboratively with other departments, including nursing, administration, and clinical services, to enhance overall patient care coordination      Participate in interdisciplinary meetings and case conferences      Communication:Communicate effectively with patients, their families, and healthcare providers to address concerns, provide updates, and ensure a positive patient experience      Act as a liaison between different departments to facilitate smooth communication and resolution of issues      Data Management:Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of patient care activities      Generate reports on key performance indicators and patient satisfaction metrics      Budget Management:Contribute to the development and management of the departmental budget      Monitor expenditures and resources to ensure efficient use of financial resources

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Assistant Supervisor - Patient Care Service to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey         Customer Service and Support    : The Assistant Patient Experience is responsible for providing excellent customer service to patients and their families. This includes greeting patients, answering their questions, addressing concerns, and ensuring they feel valued and respected throughout their healthcare journey.                Communication and Coordination    : They assist in facilitating communication between patients, their families, and healthcare providers. This may involve scheduling appointments, coordinating care services, and relaying important information to patients about their treatment plans and procedures.                Patient Satisfaction Surveys and Feedback    : The Assistant Patient Experience may be involved in collecting patient feedback through surveys and other means to assess patient satisfaction levels. They analyze this feedback to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance the overall patient experience.                Quality Improvement Initiatives    : They collaborate with healthcare teams to implement quality improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing patient satisfaction, reducing wait times, improving communication processes, and ensuring a patient-centered approach to care delivery.                Training and Education    : They may participate in training sessions for staff members to educate them on best practices for patient interaction, effective communication techniques, and strategies for delivering compassionate care.                Patient Advocacy    : The Assistant Patient Experience serves as an advocate for patients, ensuring that their voices are heard and their needs are addressed throughout their healthcare journey. They may assist patients in navigating the healthcare system and resolving any issues or concerns they may encounter.

column2: Patient Support: Providing direct care and support to patients, including assistance with daily activities, mobility, personal hygiene, and ensuring their overall comfort     Patient Advocacy: Acting as an advocate for patients, addressing their concerns, and communicating their needs to medical staff and other healthcare professionals     Care Coordination: Collaborating with healthcare teams to ensure coordinated care, including physicians, nurses, therapists, and other caregivers     Monitoring and Assistance: Observing and monitoring patients' health conditions, reporting any changes, and administering medication or treatments as directed     Patient Education: Educating patients and their families about care plans, medications, procedures, and post-discharge instructions to facilitate recovery and wellness     Emotional Support: Providing emotional support, empathy, and compassion to patients and their families during challenging times     Documentation: Maintaining accurate records of patient care activities, including vital signs, treatments administered, and any observations for the healthcare team's reference     Safety and Compliance: Adhering to safety protocols, infection control measures, and regulatory standards to ensure a safe and healthy environment for patients       Skills and Qualifications:       Compassion and Empathy: A caring and empathetic approach towards patients, demonstrating patience and understanding     Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with patients, families, and healthcare professionals     Medical Knowledge: Basic understanding of medical terminology, patient care procedures, and healthcare practices     Adaptability: Ability to adapt to various patient needs, medical conditions, and changing healthcare environments
